title: COVID-19 vaccine
cleaned_text: COVID-19 vaccine Individuals aged five years of age or older should consider delaying their COVID-19 booster until fall 2023. This will help better protect you from the serious effects of COVID-19 during the respiratory illness season. A booster dose prior to fall 2023 may be appropriate for some high-risk individuals, or those with personal situations that may require an early dose. Please speak with your health care provider for advice on receiving a booster prior to fall 2023. Recommendations from the province for fall booster doses will be available closer to fall 2023. COVID-19 immunization clinics Walk-in clinic times - Monday to Sunday - participating local pharmacies. - Tuesday to Friday - Cataraqui Centre, Kingston - 11:30 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (closed from 12:45 to 2 p.m.) - Monday - KFL&A Public Health, Kingston - 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. (closed from 12 to 1 p.m.). There is no clinic on September 4 due to the Labour Day holiday. - Monday - KFL&A Public Health, Napanee - 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. (closed from 12 to 1 p.m.). There is no clinic on September 4 due to the Labour Day holiday. Learn about [Ontario's vaccination eligibility and recommendations](https://www.ontario.ca/page/covid-19-vaccines) to help protect us against COVID19.
